page.title: 06ST. ALBAN'S COURT.
page.content: The existing house was built in 1875. The Hammond family lived at St. Alban's for four hundred years. The house provided a lot of jobs in the area. The girls would clean,cook, wash up or tend the fires.The boys did gardedning, shoe cleaning and looked after the horses. When the foundations for the present building were dug some human bones, probably Roman, were discovered. In 1938 St. Albans was sold and the building was turned into a Teacher's Training College. It had thirteen students to begin with.Next year,1986, the college will be sold. Many of the children who live in the area are very sad because they will no longer be able to use the swimming pool there.
